definition: to establish/to found/to set up/to build/to construct
to build/to construct/to ram/to hit/Taiwan pr. [zhu2]

sentences.english: We are the country with five-thousand-year culture, old buildings are one of the evidences.
sentences.chinese: 我們是用五千年文化的國家，舊建築物的依據之一。

sentences.english: The heat generated in the compression phase is normally radiated into the air outside the building.
sentences.chinese: 壓縮階段產生熱量一般被輻射到建築物外的空氣中。

sentences.english: How can developers and landscape architects work with architects, engineers to bring enough part of the greening into our buildings?
sentences.chinese: 建築和景觀的共融形成了會呼吸的建築物的概念。

sentences.english: An imposing facade, building, person, personality.
Jin Mao Tower was completed in 1999 and is the fourth tallest building of the world.
sentences.chinese: 金茂大廈於1999年完工，是世界第四高的建築物。

sentences.english: The view is of the nondescript building across the street.
sentences.chinese: 風景就是對面街那不可名狀的建築物。

sentences.english: The rescue team moved on to the next collapsed building.
sentences.chinese: 營救隊進入到下一個倒塌的建築物。

sentences.english: The carcass of a burned-out building.
sentences.chinese: 燒燬建築物的基本構架。

sentences.english: Rescuers worked after daybreak to try to reach those trapped in the rubble of collapsed buildings.
sentences.chinese: 救援人員拂曉開始搜尋被埋在倒坍建築物瓦礫中的人。

sentences.english: In some of the inner-city streets we have people trapped in buildings.
sentences.chinese: 還有市民被困在市中心的建築物中。

sentences.english: This was done by a number of means , including chipping at the buildings with pickaxes .
sentences.chinese: 這是做了一些手段，包括插話在建築物與鎬。

sentences.english: Walls of imperial palaces and royal buildings were coated with white surfacer and decorated with red paint.
sentences.chinese: 宮城城牆以及高貴建築物牆體塗抹白灰朱粉爲裝飾。

sentences.english: So it is very important to detect the anti-seismic capability of building.
sentences.chinese: 所以對建築物抗震能力進行檢測至關重要。

sentences.english: They fronted the building with red brick.
sentences.chinese: 他們用紅磚裝飾建築物的正面。

sentences.english: Investing is the use of capital to acquire assets such as buildings and equipment.
sentences.chinese: 投資勾當與投資購建資產例如建築物和裝備相關。

sentences.english: There a range of huge constructs in Beijing.
sentences.chinese: 在北京有許多壯偉的建築物。

definition: building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
to build/to construct/to ram/to hit/Taiwan pr. [zhu2]
to set up/to arrange/to establish/to found/to display
